summary: This bill, the Personal Health Investment Today Act of 2025 (PHIT Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals to deduct certain expenses related to physical activity, fitness, and exercise as medical expenses. It aims to promote health and prevent disease by encouraging healthier lifestyles and providing financial incentives. Eligible expenses include fitness facility memberships, participation in exercise programs, and equipment costs, up to specified limits. The bill defines “qualified sports and fitness expenses” and sets criteria for fitness facilities.
